question:
Who developed the theory of general relativity?
(1) Isaac Newton
(2) Albert Einstein
(3) Stephen Hawking
(4) Niels Bohr

Who is known for formulating the laws of motion and universal gravitation?
(1) Albert Einstein
(2) Galileo Galilei
(3) Isaac Newton
(4) Johannes Kepler

Who introduced the concept of quantum mechanics with the uncertainty principle?
(1) Erwin Schrödinger
(2) Werner Heisenberg
(3) Max Planck
(4) Richard Feynman

Who proposed the theory of evolution by natural selection?
(1) Louis Pasteur
(2) Gregor Mendel
(3) Charles Darwin
(4) Carl Linnaeus

Which scientist is known for discovering penicillin?
(1) Louis Pasteur
(2) Alexander Fleming
(3) Joseph Lister
(4) Robert Koch

Who formulated the standard model of particle physics?
(1) Peter Higgs
(2) Murray Gell-Mann
(3) Abdus Salam
(4) Steven Weinberg

Who is credited with developing set theory in mathematics?
(1) Carl Friedrich Gauss
(2) David Hilbert
(3) Georg Cantor
(4) Kurt Gödel

Which mathematician formulated the incompleteness theorems?
(1) Alan Turing
(2) Kurt Gödel
(3) Bertrand Russell
(4) John von Neumann

Who is considered the father of modern computer science?
(1) Alan Turing
(2) John von Neumann
(3) Claude Shannon
(4) Donald Knuth

Which economist introduced the concept of comparative advantage in trade?
(1) Adam Smith
(2) John Maynard Keynes
(3) David Ricardo
(4) Milton Friedman

Who proposed the heliocentric model of the solar system?
(1) Galileo Galilei
(2) Johannes Kepler
(3) Nicolaus Copernicus
(4) Tycho Brahe

Which psychologist is known for developing the hierarchy of needs theory?
(1) Sigmund Freud
(2) Carl Jung
(3) B.F. Skinner
(4) Abraham Maslow
